text: Can I get the BT addresses of all our beacons organized by manufacturer?
<@U026PT0D7>: can you help evans out with that?
all of the data i've collected on that is in the Device List sheet of the data spreadsheet
<https://docs.google.com/a/uncorkedstudios.com/spreadsheets/d/1i9cvcHetZ0anzmUZ6VmPoBPVwt2DOXBKrK9GrK3EXmc/edit?usp=sharing>
I can fill out the rest of that sheet this morning
but what we want is a separate table of device addresses, convenience names, and manufacturer, right?
oh thats what it is
:grinning:
i need the mapping of address to manufacturer so i can add filtering into the app
i was looking at the wrong thing
the TI mac addresses I got from the labels on the devices themselves
are those the full addresses tho or just the unique parts?
anyway, i need the full addresses. I'll add manufacturer filtering. <@U02895311>: we're gonna lose some data in this cutover. in particular, we're gonna lose tx_power
if thats a huge deal, we can keep tx_power, but we won't be able to track the TI sensors
(library incompatibility)
<@U026PHQ3J>, I don't need the TX power. Go ahead and drop it from the data
<@U026PHQ3J> i doubt those are the full addresses for the TI
the Kontakt and #2 SnF are the full addresses
<@U026PHQ3J> the S5 was already on my desk
an old read but a good read that i just revisited w/r/t Up! <http://www.cooper.com/journal/2012/08/the-best-interface-is-no-interface>
<@U026PHQ3J> the S5 still falls asleep during scan (iBeaconTest app), but it appears to record data even so
Also, the S5/iBeaconTest still doesn't pick up TI or SnF
thats correct.
stand by
<@U02895311>: linear train test data is up on dropbox <https://www.dropbox.com/sh/yja6dstpe9mrdkm/AAD1sUIrIT382gh84574Cl7ra>
note that since i was turning around the train+phone assembly, the data for the middle beacon ("just right"/C1:C9...) will look different for a forward vs backward leg.
<@U026PT0D7>: Thanks. I am looking at the distance data form earlier and going to try building a model now
<@U02895311>: for the outside stationary test the phone's box is 17.75" tall and the beacon's box is 18.875" tall
<@U026PT0D7>: Hey... Were there only 2 beacons in the train test you just did? just want to make sure
no, 3
too hot and too cold were at either end, and just right in the middle
although I dropped one of them and it broke open. if i put it back together incorrectly it's possible it was unpowered? I'll verify
sorry, too cold had no antenna in it at all
i may have to re-run all of my tests today
<@U026PHQ3J> we have complete BT MAC addresses in the data spreadsheet
thanks. I need to borrow the s5 or s4 at some point after i'm out of this meeting that i'm in now
<@U02895311>: would you like me to get new data for the linear train test? I found the third Kontakt antenna
<@U026PT0D7>: No need to run the train test yet. The distance model sucks at the moment so 2 beacons are fine
ok
